intro: Hoffmannseggella brevicaulis, commonly known as the short-stemmed hoffmannseggella, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in the summer months. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Native to regions of southern Africa, it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an attractive species for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
